news_header: A trade strike in Finland began on Monday in logistics and will extend to stores on Wednesday, lasting three days. CEO Kari Luoto of the Federation of Commerce advises consumers against hoarding food and mentions potential changes in store opening hours.
news_original_title: Maitohyllyt tyhjenivät, mutta olutta on – tältä näyttää Suomen kauppojen hyllyillä nyt
news_text: Despite the strikes, many stores still have ample supplies, although some individual products may be missing. The situation is generally stable, with stores well-stocked, and consumers have calmed their purchasing behavior after previous shortages during the pandemic.
